channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Nifty News: Blue chip NFT prices wobble, Credit Suisse tries tokens and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The floor prices for some of the largest NFT collections sunk to nearly two-year lows, but have started to edge up in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Bitcoin remains ‘primary focus’ for investors amid year highs: CoinShares
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Bitcoin investment products have experienced $310.6 million in inflows over the last two weeks.

item.title: Kyle Davies to donate future OPNX earnings to 3AC creditors for 'karma'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Three Arrows Capital co-founder Kyle Davies called it a “shadow recovery process” during a July 3 Twitter Spaces.

item.title: HK crypto ETFs on fire, Binance warns on Maverick FOMO, Poly hack: Asia Express
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Hong Kong crypto ETFs grow 80% since December, Binance’s co-founder warns against FOMOing into MAV with leverage, and Poly Network is hacked again.

item.title: TON blockchain launches on-chain encrypted messaging feature
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The network previously allowed users to post on-chain messages but only in an unencrypted, completely public way.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: BlackRock spot Bitcoin ETF filing names Coinbase as ‘surveillance-sharing’ partner
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The application included a Nasdaq-Coinbase agreement “intended to supplement the exchange’s market surveillance program” following the SEC reportedly saying the filing was unclear.

item.title: Price analysis 7/3: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, SOL, LTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: The bulls are trying to nudge Bitcoin above the critical resistance of $31,000, which may start a broad-based crypto rally.

item.title: EU finalizes Data Act with a kill switch for smart contracts: Law Decoded, June 27–July 3
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: European Union lawmakers have agreed to move ahead with the controversial European Data Act, which has previously drawn criticism from the crypto community.

item.title: ‘A lot of the bad actors have been shaken out of the market' — Bitvo CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Bitvo president and CEO Pamela Draper spoke with Cointelegraph at the Collision conference in Toronto on the firm almost being acquired by FTX and Canada's regulatory environment.

item.title: Bitcoin traders torn between breakout and $28K dip as BTC price stalls
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price action keeps everyone guessing, while Bitcoin casually marks a major achievement on monthly timeframes.

item.title: Twitter rival Mastodon’s active user base increases by 100K+
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: A day after Twitter implemented new restrictions on the number of posts users can view, rival platform Mastodon reported a major increase in traffic.

item.title: UK Law Commission recommends ‘distinct’ legal category for crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The U.K.’s Law Commission highlights four major recommendations to reform laws relating to cryptocurrency use and ownership.

item.title: Chibi Finance $1M alleged rug pull: How it happened
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The exploiter used a “panic” function buried within eight different smart contracts to remove $1 million worth of users’ funds without their permission.

item.title: Generative AI will disrupt blockchain too: Here’s how
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tomer Warschauer Nuni
item.description: Artificial intelligence isn’t just generating lots of content these days, but equally, lots of excitement too.

item.title: Singapore to require crypto firms to put user assets into trusts by year-end
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: MAS is also working to restrict crypto service providers from facilitating lending or staking for retail customers, but not for institutional ones.

item.title: 5 blockchain-based social media platforms to know
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Discover five blockchain-based social media platforms that are reshaping online interactions.

item.title: Robot guest-conducts the Korean National Symphony Orchestra
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The android robot EveR 6 and conductor Soo-Yeoul Choi co-conducted a performance of six pieces with the Korean National Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: Thai SEC bans the use of customer crypto assets for lending and investment
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Investor protection regulations have been under discussion since September 2022 amid the crypto lending crisis that saw firms such as BlockFi and Celsius declare bankruptcy.

item.title: Crypto Twitter has a persistent ‘fake followers’ problem, data reveals
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Shiba Inu had the greatest number of fake followers at 10.26% or 80,000 accounts, while Avalanche and Polygon followed suit with 8.14% and 7.58% of fake accounts, respectively.

item.title: Belarus wants to ban P2P cryptocurrency transactions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Belarus cited a high crypto crime rate for banning all citizens from exchanging Bitcoin with each other.

item.title: Hut 8 relocates 6,400 rigs, sees growth in AI and high-performance computing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Bitcoin mining firm Hut8 continues to relocate miners from its idle North Bay site, with increasing demand for AI and high-power computing.

item.title: Miners send millions to exchanges — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin miners appear to be reducing risk as the significance of BTC price above $30,000 remains firmly in evidence.

item.title: Half of stolen NFTs are sold within 3 hours: PeckShield
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: PeckShield reports that $2.27 million of NFTs were stolen in June, recording the lowest monthly figure for stolen NFTs in 2023.

item.title: Bitcoin options strategy: How to trade July’s Q2 earnings
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Professional traders can hedge their Bitcoin bets using the iron condor options strategy as the Q2 earnings season comes into play.

item.title: AzukiDAO proposes to recover 20,000 ETH from Azuki founder ‘Zagabond’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Members of the DAO claim to be a dedicated group of Azuki enthusiasts. It’s the latest wrinkle following the launch of the controversial “Elementals” NFT collection.

item.title: SEC has pushed investors into ‘toxic’ crypto products and FTX: Winklevoss
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Gemini co-founder Cameron Winklevoss said the SEC’s refusal to approve a spot Bitcoin ETF has been a “complete and utter disaster for U.S. investors.“

item.title: Poly Network urges users to withdraw after exploit affects 57 crypto assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The Poly Network has been exploited again, this time due to compromised private keys, according to blockchain security firm Dedaub.

item.title: Elon Musk imposes ‘rate limit’ on Twitter, citing extreme ‘system manipulation’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Verified Twitter users will be allowed to view 10,000 posts daily, while new, unverified accounts will get 500 under the new limits.

item.title: AI-generated fake news sparks rumors of Gary Gensler’s resignation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: The rumors, which have set Crypto Twitter ablaze, are the latest example of AI disinformation at work.
